dublinCore.dc:title: SCON 36 ENR: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen
form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg.

section.header: Use of rotunda for ceremony to award congressional gold medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg

subsection.text: The rotunda of the Capitol is authorized to be used on July 9, 2014, for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg in recognition of his achievements and heroic actions during the Holocaust.
Physical preparations for the ceremony described in subsection (a) shall be carried out in accordance with such conditions as the Architect of the Capitol may prescribe.

attestation-group.role: Clerk of the House of Representatives
